title: "Team game"
body:
How is this game claimed to be a team game when {{champion:222}} gets a double kill bot then even a snowballed {{champion:23}} becomes invalid ?

Lose botlane lose game, the best rule ever.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1722274923/51018730?tab=overview

Jinx gets a couple kills bot, game is literally over from there. When 1 auto attack from 700 range does 35% of your health, so much fun.

Real talk, are ADCs getting nerfed any time soon? This is getting really boring..

replies.body: you placed 3 wards the entire 46 minute long game...

Which is the reason why I got so many kills. I switched to upgraded sweeper once I hit lvl 9. Rengar's ult and Akali's shroud were useless against me.

Edit: accidentally said lvl6, lvl9*.
so you stop buying wards at lvl 9? GG
Sounds like a L2P issue.
If you think ADC's are so OP why don't you play it yourself then?
Not my style, 6 classes exist for a reason.
your style is a right-click champion that has invincibility? ok
Trynd, riven, jayce. What do these champs have in common? All of them can get fed top lane and carry a game. Bot lane isn't the only lane that can carry.
So what about all those games where the bot lane wins, but the game is still lost? Your argument is invalid and merely emotionally fueled nonsense.

That only happens when some super assassin is fed e.g old {{champion:105}} and {{champion:84}}.

I'm not a fan of assassins either.

It's sickening how top lane champions are irrelevant in this game, examples: {{champion:98}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:31}}.

What do these champions have in common? They don't jump in the ADC's face effectively like a {{champion:54}} or do insane damage ( that also can kill the ADC ) like {{champion:68}}.

Seriously, do you rather face {{champion:107}} {{champion:254}} every game instead ? ADCs should be toned down significantly.

Not saying there is or is not an issue with any role. I'm saying Bot lane is in now way *the* winning factor. It does however have an advantage to be so, since it has 2 kills to be had so is worth more time. If you stuck the support with top lane then all of a sudden that lane would be worth more time.

Dragon + person dealing tons of damage *too* safely is in botlane. Its not because of the number of champions.

1 skilled ADC wins the game on his own. There's a reason why many of the top spot holders in challenger are ADC mains like C9 Sneaky & WildTurtle + his smurfs.

If you think it's so awesome then do like the other guy said and run ADC, in top lane if you want. Staying Top with someone like Tryndamere just proves you're only doing what everyone else says is good and don't really believe what you are saying.

Do what you think is fun, that is the point of video games. But don't complain when what you think is fun isn't also competitively effective.

You somewhat have a point.

But then again {{champion:55}} & {{champion:84}} are extremely effective "competitively"  in soloQ. Is that supposed to be healthy, either ?

I honestly don't like 100-0 interactions ( {{champion:53}} {{champion:7}} )

Or "kite you for days" interactions ( {{champion:429}} {{champion:268}} )

But I don't design this game. I do give feed back that this is not fun to play against however, and so as players said this repeatedly; causing DFG's removal.

Because of the way ADCs were designed, champions like {{champion:84}} &{{champion:105}} are considered fair in terms of design. But they really aren't fun to play against for most of the players. I rather have ADCs nerfed & these pesky assassins as a result.
Stop using the term "healthy". It's an excuse people use when they lose, that the enemy was using an "unhealthy" champion.

Lol. Excuse he said, that must be why the reworked {{champion:101}} & {{champion:72}}. Pros must've been crying that they were unhealthy. 

Anyway, I didn't complain about Akali on the main topic. The main point is ADCs.

Well, it happened again.

"lose botlane lose game"

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1722584400/51018730?tab=overview

Ryze was doing okay-ish until teamfights. :\

I just came from a game where we had Ad Janna top, no jungler (i was the mythical river shen), and didn't take a single dragon until the 55 minute mark. At the end of the game our ezreal had more kills than Jinx, but that was because he just has the stronger late game. Jinx became much more fed much faster in the game. The enemy team gotten the 5th dragon stack buff twice and we still managed to win despite losing almost every teamfight except for one where we caught them at baron. How did we do this? Coordination and Communication aka teamwork. What we did was we sent 4 people to distract the enemyy team while sending another person to splitpush. We would roam as a group catching people our whenever the enemies split up. We didn' win though a superior team comp or by getting our adc fed. We won by working as a team. 

Also looking at your game, a vast majority of your teams kill are on you and only you. Over half the teams kills were ones you had, meaning an incredibly large chunk of the teams power was focused in you. The enemy team balanced out their kills more. Akali had 14, Jinx had 14, and Udyr had 10. That means the enemy had 3 potential people who could be a serious threat in a fight. Now without seeing the actual fights themselves I can't make any definitive claims about where you could have given the kill to someone else, but keep that in mind.

In the end if you really despise adcs so much go play teemo. I had a teemo support go 2/20 in lane to the enemy adc, but manage to 1v1 her late game and win because of the blind. That is not even an exaggeration on the amount of kills. He ended the game about 7/27/14 and the final score was 55 kills our team 90 kills their team, but somehow we won. Weird shit happens sometimes.

We're talking about soloQ, while I hate talking crap about my teammates; there wasn't a solid opportunity to leave the kill for an ally ( normally because they explode so fast or get caught out 24/7 like allied Cait. q_q

* You must have 1v5 a lot, since you're a {{champion:23}} . It's common sense. Ironic when you're asking for a "team game"...
* It's not that ADC is overpowered, you just ended up with the suckiest ADC in your team.
* I guess having either {{item:3026}} or no {{item:3026}} really shows a lot of strength differences, even her extra 50 armor could change a lot. See, I don't do glass cannon.
* Enemy team has 5 dragons, your team only has one. There's a clear reason how the enemy ADC overtook you.

* No I did not 1v5, I actually fought with my team as Trynd while my job is supposed to be split pushing, they can't handle the Jinx siege pressure alone.
* The ADC class is overpowered. This is not my first complaint about the class and many diamonds/challengers such as "FalconPawwwwwwnch" and "Hashinshin" brought this matter to forums and boards before I did.
* I'm not sure if I understood what you meant with the {{item:3026}} point.
* Yes, when botlane wins. There is free reign over dragon, I believe you know this as well. That point aside, if you hover on where dragons occured in the match history you will see that I was involved in fights at that time. I did not ignore dragons or their fights, our team simply cannot handle a snowballed ADC like {{champion:222}}. In the past {{champion:51}} & {{champion:236}} had this effect as well due to their design of "jack of all trades", when they win; their team wins fights and thus the game.
thats why you get teleport
